steps.text: Determine employee actions in an accident
Evaluate preventive maintenance adequacy
Implement fire risk management during daily work
Perform scheduled maintenance according to manufacturer's instructions
Participate in manufacturer recall campaigns
Use authentic replacement parts from known manufacturers
Inspect and clean the engine compartment and surroundings
Use compressed air to remove dirt after cleaning
Inspect for leaks after cleaning
Check the engine compartment for cleanliness
Inspect for liquids and leaks in the engine compartment
Check joints of hoses and pipes
Check the engine compartment for oil leaks
Visually inspect electrical systems
Document the inspections
Use a multimeter to measure voltage drops
Inspect electrical systems daily on electric-powered and hybrid machines
Use a thermal imaging camera to detect anomalies in alternators, cables, and earthing points
Compare readings with an intact machine
Check main power switch
Shut down the engine and cut power
Repair any malfunction that required its use
Resume operation
Repair any deviations
Check cables not protected by a fuse (battery, alternator, starter motor)
Replace cables showing signs of abrasion or heat damage
Protect them with a housing pipe
Keep cables clean of oil and dirt
Do not attach cable harnesses to hoses or pipes
Protect and firmly attach cable harnesses
Ensure cable connections are tight and have terminal covers
Check the electric panel during maintenance
Repair any redundant or hanging wires
Ensure fuse boxes are intact and have lids
Check that fuses are the correct size
Investigate the cause of any blown fuse
Attach cables
The alternator must be firmly attached with correct belt tension and have terminal covers.
Keep any alternator filter clean to prevent overheating.
Check for anomalies with a thermal camera.
During maintenance, check fasteners, belts, and bearings.
Replace noisy bearings.
Exhaust pipe: Check for leaks and ensure all thermal shields are in place.
Never leave the machine unattended during regeneration
Inspect all hoses and electrical systems in the swivelling joint weekly
Remove any rocks or twigs immediately
Ensure all operating manuals are available in the machine in a language the operator understands
Before winter, check the cleanliness and condition of the auxiliary heater, its compartment, and its wiring
The heater compartment must be clean and free of fuel leaks
Inspect the heater's exhaust pipe to ensure it doesn't touch anything flammable
Test the heater under supervision before use
Confirm system's operation at start-up
Repair any malfunction immediately
Step 1: Prepare the surface by cleaning it with water and detergent
Step 2: Rinse the surface thoroughly with clean water
Step 3: Dry the surface with a lint-free cloth
Step 4: Apply the adhesive to the surface
Step 5: Press the patch onto the adhesive
Step 6: Allow the adhesive to cure for 24 hours
Call for help (emergency number 112)
Use the 112 smartphone app if possible
Perform first-aid fire extinguishing
Confirm fire is out with fire department
Report incident to safety officer, site manager, coworkers, and insurance company
Stop and leave machine in place if possible
Report all accidents and dangerous situations to a supervisor immediately
Wear protective clothing and a helmet
Use a hands-free device for phone calls
Wear a safety belt
Use stepladders and handrails
maintain three points of contact when climbing
Keep doors closed during operation
Ensure tools are secure
Ensure emergency exits are marked
Repair any malfunctions that could lead to an accident without delay

entities.context: Business continuity planning is good risk management. A company can transfer risks through subcontracting or insurance, but the entrepreneur still bears responsibility according to the insurance terms...
